intro: Impatiens phahompokensis, commonly known as the Phahom Poknens Island Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
